english: falling wild geese; to make geese fall (by stunning beauty)

etymology.description: 落 ‘descend; fall’ + 雁 ‘wild goose’ = geese descending; by extension, beauty that makes geese fall.
etymology.interpretation: Literally depicts wild geese coming down from the sky. Figuratively praises striking feminine beauty, as in the idiom 沉鱼落雁.

parts.english: to fall; to drop; to descend; to land

examples.chinese: 黄昏时(黃昏時)，天边落雁成行(天邊落雁成行)。
examples.english: At dusk, lines of geese descend along the horizon.

examples.chinese: 她有落雁之姿(她有落雁之姿)，被赞为绝色(被讚為絕色)。
examples.pinyin: Tā yǒu luòyàn zhī zī, bèi zàn wéi juésè.
examples.english: She has a beauty that could make geese fall and is praised as stunning.

examples.chinese: 这款妆容主打“沉鱼落雁”的古典风格(這款妝容主打「沉魚落雁」的古典風格)。
examples.pinyin: Zhè kuǎn zhuāngróng zhǔdǎ “chényú luòyàn” de gǔdiǎn fēnggé.
examples.english: This makeup look highlights the classical style of “sinking fish and falling geese.”
